intro: Doria undulosa, commonly known as the wavy doria, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, undulating leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements, it is occasionally cultivated as an ornamental plant.
